Package org.wildloop

package org.wildloop

WildLoop

WildLoop is an application simulating interaction between predators and prey in a grid-based environment. The project demonstrates basic principles of ecosystem and animal behavior in a controlled environment.

Main Components

  • StartApp - Main application window managing the user interface
  • SimulationPanel - Panel responsible for displaying and controlling simulation
  • SimulationConfig - Import of default simulation configuration
  • World - Representation of a simulation world and its logic
  • Position - Representation of immutable position in 2D space
  • Direction - Representation of displacement vectors
  • Animal - Abstract base class for all animals
  • Prey - Implementation of prey
  • Predator - Implementation of predator

Features

  • Interactive ecosystem simulation
  • Configurable simulation parameters (world size, number of animals)
  • Real-time visualization
  • Population statistics
  • Ability to pause/resume simulation

Running the Application

The application is launched through the main method which creates a new instance of StartApp in Swing's Event Dispatch Thread (EDT) using SwingUtilities.invokeLater(Runnable).

System Requirements

  • Java 24 or newer
  • Graphical environment supporting Swing
Version:
0.52

  • Class
    Description
    Animal
    Abstract base class representing an animal in the simulation.
    Direction
    Represents world directions and associated displacement vectors.
    Main
    Main application class containing program entry point.
    Position
    Represents an immutable position in two-dimensional space.
    Predator
    Represents predator in the simulation.
    Prey
    Represents prey in the simulation.
    SimulationConfig
    Manages configuration settings for the simulation.
    SimulationPanel
    Represents the main graphical user interface for the simulation, consisting of a grid-based world inhabited by predators and prey, and provides controls for managing and displaying the simulation state.
    StartApp
    Extends JFrame and serves as the main user interface container for the application.
    World
    Represents the simulation world where animals can move and interact.
